instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin?
Output: The past study used Fourier-transform near-infrared (FT-NIR) spectroscopy to acquire spectral information of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea samples.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin spectroscopy?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used were Savitzky–Golay (SG) filter, standard normal variable (SNV) transformation, and baseline correction.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification accuracy of the optimized extreme learning machine (ELM) model on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The classification accuracy metric was chosen to evaluate the optimized ELM model, achieving a 95.35% accuracy in the test set.

instruction: What machine learning models were used on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin using Fourier-transform near-infrared (FT-NIR) spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning model used on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin using Fourier-transform near-infrared (FT-NIR) spectroscopy is the extreme learning machine (ELM) model.

instruction: Can the combination of optimized variable selection method and NIR spectroscopy be considered a superior strategy for tea traceability in narrow regions, on the rapid identification of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea of narrow geographical origin using Fourier-transform near-infrared (FT-NIR) spectroscopy?
Output: Yes. The combination of optimized variable selection method and NIR spectroscopy can be considered a superior strategy for tea traceability in narrow regions. The past study demonstrated that this combination achieved a high classification accuracy of 95.35% in identifying the geographical origin of Taiping Houkui (TPHK) green tea. This indicates that the optimized variable selection method in conjunction with NIR spectroscopy is an effective approach for tracing the origin of tea in narrow geographical areas.
